Description: Alabaster alabastron; cylindrical body tapering at the neck with flat everted rim and two lug handles; polished.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: For Cypriot parallels from established archaeoloigcal contexts see: SCE IV/2, fig. 39 no 38 (Marion); Chavane 1990, 78-80, esp. 588-656 passim and pl. XVIII (Amathus); Salles and Chavane 2003, 336-7 nos 811-19 and figs 263, 265 (Kition- Bamboula, Hellenistic levels).See Chavane 1990, 77-8 for a general comment (with bibliography) on the difficulty of dating these vessels on form alone. Bibliography: Chavane, M.-J. 1990, La nécropole d'Amathonte. Tombs 110-385. IV. Les petits objets (Nicosia). Salles, J.-F. and Chavane, M.-J. 2003, 'Les petits objets' in J.-F. Salles ed. Kition-Bamboula IV. Les niveaux héllenistiques (Paris), 331-46.
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 119, tomb 84)
